entries.meaning: (interrogative) Where ever; an emphatic form of where.
examples: Wherever have you been all my life?

entries.meaning: (informal) In, at or to any place that one likes or chooses.
examples: I don't care what you do with it; just put it wherever.
Where do you want to have lunch? — Wherever; I don't mind.

entries.meaning: (fused relative) The place (no matter where) in, at or to which.
examples: He's back from wherever he's been hiding.
Go home to wherever you belong.
